page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: PATTERDALES ORIGINAL NAME WAS ST PATRICKS DALE .IT WAS NAMED AFTER ST PATRICK WHEN HE VISTED HERE ALONG TIME AGO . ABOUT A HUNDRED AND FIFTY YEARS AGO WILLAM WORDSWORTH PASSED THROUGH THE DALE AND SPOTTED HIS FAMOUS DAFFODILS ON THE SHORES OF ULLSWATER. ST PATRICKS WELL CAN BE FOUND BY THE SIDE OF THE MAIN ROAD BETWEEN PATTERDALE AND GLENRIDDING. THIS WAS SUPPOSED TO BE THE PLACE WHERE ST PATRICK BAPTISED PEOPLE .NEARBY IS A LARGE HISTORIC HOUSE CALLED PATTEERDALE HALL. TODAY IT IS USED AS A RESIDENTIAL CENTRE. THE LOCAL CHURCH IS ALSO CALLED AFTER ST PATRICK. BESIDES THE ANGLICAN CHURCH THERE ARE TWO OTHER PLACES OF WORSHIP, A MODERN CATHOLIC CHAPEL AND A METHODIST HALL.
